DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death International Classification of Diseases Version Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for the coding scheme used to code the cause of death.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death International Classification of Diseases Version
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The coding scheme used to code the cause of death.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:To occur again.:The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12):Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases Version Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12)_Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases Version Number Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12):Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
